did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Surveyor, Falls of James River: pay and expense vouchers, 1803-1821

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Surveyor, Falls of James River: pay and expense vouchers, 1803-1821. Accession APA 294, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: On 24 January 1803 the General Assembly passed an act prohibiting the use of fish dams or traps on the James River each year between 1 June and the end of February of the succeeding year. The governor appointed a surveyor of the falls of James River to enforce the act; offenders were subject to a hundred dollar fine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes vouchers listing the names of persons to whom money was owed, the amounts, and the dates the vouchers were submitted. The items cover the following dates: 1803-1806, 1808-1814, 1816-1819, and 1821.
